div.l: For of thy ꝑpersile / yit þei fare the wers
That þei haue eten wᵗith þe stubbil goos
For in thy schoppe is many a flie loos
Now tell on gentill Rogger by þy name
But yit y pᵃray þe be not wroth for game
A man may sey ful soth in game and pley
Þou seyst ful soth qduod Rogger be my fey
But soth pley quaad pley / as þe flemyng seith
And þerfor henry bailly by thy feith
Be now not wroth // er we deꝑparte here
Þowgh þat my tale be of an hostelere
But neủer þe las y wol not tell it yit
But or we part ywis þou schalt be quit
And þerwᵗithall he lough and made Chere
And seide his tale as ye schall aftir here
A Prentis whilom dwelde in oure Cite
Of a Crafte of þe vitallers was hee
And gaillard was he as a goldfynche in þe schawe
Broun̄ as a bery a propre schorte Felawe
Wᵗith lokkes blake kempte full fetously
Daunce he cowde ful wele and iolily
Þat he was cleped Piers Revelour
He was as full of love and ꝑparamour
As is þe hyve / þat is ful of hony swete
Well was þe wenche þat wᵗith hym myght mete
Att eủery bredale wolde he synge and hoppe
He loued better þe Taủerne then the schoppe
For when any ridyng was in Chepe
Out of þe schoppe deder wolde he lepe
Til þat he had all þe sight seyn̄
And daunced well // he wolde come a yen̄
And gadre hym a mayne of his sort
To hoppe ⁊and syng ⁊and make suche disport
And þer as þei sett stevyn for to mete
To pley att þe Dise in suche a strete
For in þe Toun þer was no prentys
Þat fairer cowde cast a peire of dys
Þan Piers cowde / ⁊and þerto he was fre
Of his expence in place of previte
Þat fonde his master wel in his Chaffare
For ofte tyme he fonde his box full bare
For sothe a Prentys a Revelour
Þat hauntith dise Riot ⁊and ꝑparamour
His master schall it in his shop̄e abie
Þowgh he haue no part of þe mynstralcye
For thefte and riote þei been conủertible
All can he pley on giterne or rebible
Revel ⁊and trowth as in a lowe Degre
Þei be full wroth // alday men may see
Þis ioly Prentys wᵗith his master stood
Till he was nygh out of his p̉rentishood
All were he snybbed bothe erly and late
And somtyme ladde for revell to Newgate
